text:
Rossana Rossanda (23 April 1924 – 20 September 2020) was an Italian left-wing politician, journalist, and feminist. She was born in Pula, then-Kingdom of Italy. She was a member of the Italian Communist Party and Proletarian Unity Party Between 1963 to 1968, she was a member of the Chamber of Deputies. In 1969, she founded the newspaper "Il manifesto".
Rossanda died on 20 September 2020 in Rome at the age of 96.
